reviewText: After watching the depressing bio pic, Let's Get Lost, I needed to see Chet depicted in a positive way. This concert is Chet at his best: cool, effortlessly creating intimate moods with his horn ('Round Midnight was especially beautiful), and treating us to one vocal on Just Friends. This was filmed on February 29, 1980 at the Pub Le Dreher in Paris. He is accompanied by Maurizio Gianmarco on tenor saxophone, Dennis Luxion on piano, Ricardo Del Fra on bass and Donny Donable on drums. Del Fra would also be Chet's bassist six years later on the excellent CHET BAKER LIVE AT RONNIE SCOTT'S. The entire set list is: An Afternoon at Home 'Round Midnight Just Friends Budo Love for Sale There is an approximate seven minute interview between 'Round Midnight and Just Friends. Overall every songs swings like mad, and has a wonderful West Coast feel despite the saxophonist and bassist being Italian - or, perhaps because of it since the Europeans were keeping jazz alive and still are. Chet looks twenty years younger on this video than he would look a mere six years later at Ronnie Scott's. His playing, however, is superb on both videos.
